title: Microlearning Strategies to Alleviate Computer-Based Mathematics Learning Anxiety

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding Basic Mathematical Concepts and Basic Smartphone Usage Skills
context.additional_context: Meeting the math learning needs of current practitioners linked to their work, with considerations for accessibility in limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners identify three or more anxiety-inducing factors in computer-assisted assessment (CAA) scenarios.
Learners reduce anxiety levels by over 20% when solving math problems in smartphone-based microlearning environments.
Learners apply self-directed learning strategies (e.g., time management, breathing techniques) to mitigate anxiety in actual assessments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
